title: (x) Very thin sans in Korean magazine spread - Apex New {Village}
content:
The font looked familiar but I’m clueless. Appreciate if anything can help.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [comm\_photo\_46567.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20071104142624/http:/typophile.com/files/comm_photo_46567.jpg) | 107.62 KB |

 [‹ Screenprinting screen letters](http://web.archive.org/web/20071104142624/http:/www.typophile.com/node/29201 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) 2wice magazine nameplate - Swift {Patricia} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071104142624/http:/www.typophile.com/node/29191 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Hinching Chan

comments.content:
That is the Thin weight of Apex New. (There is some odd pixellation in your image.)  
 [http://vllg.com/Thirstype/ApexNew/mudTyper+Weights/](http://web.archive.org/web/20071104142624/http:/vllg.com/Thirstype/ApexNew/mudTyper+Weights/)

Apex Sans is the typeface used in Esquire Magazine, the home of “Women We Love”.
could it be a slighly distorted Fedra Display Hairline ( [www.typotheque.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20071104142624/http:/www.typotheque.com/ "www.typotheque.com"))?
